items.text: thick outside edge to third man
driven into the gap, wide of cover point as they jog the single
nearly chopped on! Races off a thick inside edge to fine leg.
slides one down leg as he looks to sweep
fired full and fast on middle, defended back.
items.shortText: Mosaddek Hossain to Gayle, no run

items.text: full on off again, defended towards cover.
items.shortText: Mosaddek Hossain to Gayle, no run

items.text: drifts one in from wide of the crease, played back towards the bowler
items.shortText: Mosaddek Hossain to Gayle, no run

items.text: too full on middle and leg, eased to long-on
gets fully forward and defends back.
items.shortText: Mosaddek Hossain to Hetmyer, no run

items.text: punched down to long-on
short of length angling away, punched to mid-on
beaten by a superb off-cutter. Excellent change of pace, Gayle looked for the drive but no feet again.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Gayle, no run

items.text: forceful drive to mid-off
turns this slower and fuller delivery to midwicket.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hetmyer, no run

items.text: pulled and pulled very nicely. Short, this skidded through but he swivelled nicely and pulled in front of square.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hetmyer, FOUR runs

items.text: squeezes the drive to cover
eases this drive to cover point
items.postText: Jaya: "Gayle is not a big fish in Odi in comparison with T20s... But today in his return, I reckon he could be the greatest headache for BD. I don't mind his low strike rate currently. That will definitely mount rapidly as he settles bcz he is the Universe Boss"
items.shortText: Mosaddek Hossain to Hetmyer, no run

items.text: eased into the off side
items.shortText: Mosaddek Hossain to Hetmyer, no run

items.text: lunges forward and blocks
items.shortText: Mosaddek Hossain to Hetmyer, no run

items.text: steps out and eases to mid-off.

Bangladesh have reviewed an lbw appeal off Gayle. He looked to punch this, got it through to midwicket. Was he saved by an inside edge? No inside edge, so pad first and then bat. Let's see what ball tracking shows up. Umpire's call . Good decision by S Ravi, Bangladesh retain their review but it was a very optimistic one.
items.postText: Brutus_Shylock: "Hmmm, a lot of criticism came down Bangladesh's way, because of the way they batted, esp. in middle overs. Well, Windies would hope that they can keep the required rate to around 6-7 for the last 20, or it may be too late for them as well. Well, unless Russell and his clone Powell strike in end overs."

items.text: steps out to drive, gets a thick inside edge onto the boot and then to the off side.
items.shortText: Mosaddek Hossain to Hetmyer, no run

items.text: steered into the gap at square third man, could've been a better effort by Sabbir at backward point.
belted over mid-off, all the way over the fence. Just a touch too full, even then not really a half-volley, and he was ready to pounce on it.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Gayle, SIX runs

items.text: squirts this drive to mid-off for a quick single
